title: The wick in the candle of learning: Epistemic curiosity activates reward circuitry and enhances memory
summary: Epistemic curiosity (desire for knowledge) activates the same brain regions as extrinsic rewards (food, sex). It also enhances memory consolidation for the information learned during the curious state.

effectiveness_metrics.description: Information learned while curious is recalled better 1-2 weeks later compared to non-curious states.

mechanisms.name: Intrinsic Reward Activation
mechanisms.description: Learning itself provides a dopamine hit, reducing the need for external gamification badges.

mechanisms.name: Anticipation Effect
mechanisms.description: The period of 'not knowing' (anticipation) is highly stimulating and engaging.

actionable_strategies.name: Knowledge Teaser Template
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: Use a 'Click to Reveal' interaction pattern for micro-learning content to maximize the anticipation phase.

actionable_strategies.name: Curiosity-Driven Bridge
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: When drift is detected due to boredom, offer a 'Did you know?' fact about their current study topic instead of a generic break.
